artist: World's End pottery; Factory owned by Henry Delamain
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. George R. Steiner
description: In form of spindle with base and socket decorated with polychrome flowers on opaque white glaze; may have been made under the auspices of one of Henry Delamain's successors shortly after his death.
text:
Worldâ€™s End pottery
Dublin, Ireland
 
Candlestick pair c.1760
Tin-glazed earthenware with polychrome
 
Gift of Mr. and Mrs. George R. Steiner   97.32.1.1,.2
 
These candlesticks were created by the earliest Irish pottery manufacture established in Dublin. The spiral design on the stem indicates it was hand thrown on a ceramics wheel. Irish craftsman were often known to reference Chinese porcelain patterns. Although, it is likely that this blue and yellow flower motif was inspired by perennial wildflowers that flourished in country sides of Ireland.
title: Candlestick, one of a pair
